about.title: About
about.desc: We are the Shile Shilaka Team. We are based at Guadalajara, Jalisco, Mexico (Yeah! the land where Tequila and Mariachis comes from). We are a group of developers from different parts of Mexico: Chihuahua, Puebla, Mexico City, Guadalajara.

history.title: History
history.desc: Loteria is a Mexican game of chance, similar to bingo, but using images on a deck of cards instead of plain numbers on ping pong balls. Every image has a name and an assigned number, but the number is usually ignored. Each player has at least one tabla, a board with a randomly created 4 x 4 grid of pictures with their corresponding name and number. Players choose what tabla they want to play with, from a variety of previously created tablas. Each one presents a different selection of images. Loteria is the Spanish word for lottery. The deck is composed of a set of 54 different images, each one in a card. To start the game, the caller (cantor, or singer) randomly selects a card from the deck and announces it to the players by its name, sometimes using a riddle or humorous patter instead of reading the card name. The players with a matching pictogram on their board mark it off with a chip or other kind of marker (many Mexican people traditionally use small rocks, crown corks or pinto beans as markers). The first player with four chips in a horizontal, vertical or diagonal row, squared pattern,any other previously specified pattern, or fills the tabla first shouts "¡Lotería!" (Lottery!) or "¡Buenas!" (Good!) and is the winner. History of Loteria The origin of lottery can be traced far back in history. The game originated in Italy in the 15th century and was brought to New Spain (Mexico) in 1769. In the beginning, Loteria was a hobby of the upper classes, but eventually it became a tradition at mexican fairs.

01.riddle: The one that sang to St. Peter will sing for him again

02.name: The Devil
02.riddle: Behave yourself so that the little red one doesn't carry you off

03.name: The Lady
03.riddle: Refined walking along the entire main street

04.name: The Dandy
04.riddle: Don Ferruco in the Alameda wanted to toss away his cane

05.riddle: For the sun and the rain

06.name: The Mermaid
06.riddle: Don't get dizzy with the songs of the mermaid

07.name: The Ladder
07.riddle: Climb me step by step You don't try to hop up

09.riddle: The bricklayer drank so much, he ended up like a barrel

10.name: The Tree
10.riddle: He who nears a good tree, good shade blankets him

11.name: The Melon
11.riddle: Give it to me or take it away

12.name: The Brave Man
12.riddle: Why do you flee, coward? Having such a good dagger

13.name: The Bonnet
13.riddle: Put the bonnet on the baby, lest he catch a cold

16.name: The Flag
16.riddle: Green, white, and red, the soldier's flag

17.name: The Mandolin
17.riddle: Simon the mariachi is there playing his mandolin

18.name: The Cello
18.riddle: Growing it reached the heavens, and since it wasn't a violin, it had to be a cello

19.name: The Heron
19.riddle: At the other side of the river I have my sand bank, where my darling brunette sits, she has a nose as a heron beak

20.name: The Bird
20.riddle: You have me hopping here and there, like a bird on a branch

22.name: The Boot
22.riddle: A boot just like the other

24.name: The Parrot
24.riddle: Parrot parrot, put out your claw and start to talk

25.name: the Drunkard
25.riddle: I cannot put up with the foolish drunk

27.name: The Heart
27.riddle: Do not miss me, darling, I'll be back by bus

28.name: The Watermelon
28.riddle: Juan's swollen belly was due to eating too much watermelon

29.name: the Drum
29.riddle: Do not wrinkle, old leather, I want you for a drum

30.name: The Shrimp
30.riddle: The shrimp that falls asleep is carried away by the water's current

31.name: The Arrows
31.riddle: The Indian Adán's arrows, where they hit, they strike

32.name: The Musician
32.riddle: The rubber-lips musician does not want to play any more

33.name: The Spider
33.riddle: Beat it silly, do not let it reach me!

34.name: The Soldier
34.riddle: One, two and three, the soldier heads to headquarters

36.name: The Billycan
36.riddle: I do not pay much attention to you

37.name: The World
37.riddle: This world is a sphere and we are too many

38.name: The Apache
38.riddle: Ah, Chihuahua! So many Apaches with pants and huarache

39.name: The Cactus
39.riddle: The cactus only receives attention when it bears fruit

40.name: The Scorpion
40.riddle: He who stings with his tail receives a beating

41.name: The Rose
41.riddle: Rosita, Rosaura, come here, I want you now

42.name: The Skull
42.riddle: While passing by the cemetery, I found a skull

43.name: The Bell
43.riddle: You with the bell and I with your sister

44.name: The Water Pitcher
44.riddle: The water pitches goes to the water so often, it breaks and wets your slip

45.name: The Deer
45.riddle: It jumps around searching, but sees nothing

46.name: The Sun
46.riddle: The Sun is the blanket of the poor

48.name: The Canoe
48.riddle: Lupita rows and rows, sitting in her little boat

49.name: The Pine Tree
49.riddle: Fresh and pleasantly scented, beautiful all the time

50.name: The Fish
50.riddle: This one dies by its mouth, even if it was mute in life

51.name: The Palm Tree
51.riddle: Palmer, climb the palm tree and bring me a real coconut

52.name: The Flowerpot
52.riddle: He who is born to be a plant pot will not leave the hallway

53.name: The Harp
53.riddle: My mother-in-law's old harp is no longer fit to play
